problem.headline: ## Product Discovery Shouldn't Be This Hard
problem.subheadline: ### Why teams struggle with the product discovery process
problem.subheadline_alt: *Why teams struggle with the product discovery process*

pain_points.title: **Disconnected Tools Create Data Silos**
pain_points.description: Vision in slides, personas in docs, business model in spreadsheets. Your team wastes hours searching for information and reconciling conflicting data across tools. This fragmented product discovery process leads to misalignment and delays.

pain_points.title: **No Clear Path from Idea to Validation**
pain_points.description: You have a product idea, but no structured product discovery framework to research customers, validate assumptions, or plan the business. Teams skip critical discovery steps and build the wrong thing.

pain_points.title: **Lost Context Between Strategy and Execution**
pain_points.description: Your vision doesn't connect to personas. Personas don't inform the business model. By the time you build features, you've lost sight of why they matter to customers. This supports continuous product discovery methods.

pain_points.title: **Can't Identify What to Validate First**
pain_points.description: Every assumption feels important. Without a product validation framework to assess risk and importance, you don't know which ideas to test first‚Äîleading to wasted experiments or analysis paralysis.

capability_workflow.headline: ## The Complete Product Discovery Workflow

capability_workflow.description: Our **product discovery tool** guides you through a proven product discovery process. Start with strategic vision, understand your customers deeply, then validate your business model‚Äîall with data flowing seamlessly between stages. This process supports how to validate product ideas before building.

steps.title: ### Define Your Product Vision

steps.what_you_create:
- Vision statement defining your product's long-term mission
- Target groups identifying customer segments to serve
- Needs describing value propositions for each segment
- Product description outlining key features and differentiation
- Business goals with measurable success criteria
steps.capabilities:

- **Rich text editing** with formatting, lists, links
- **Target group cards** with drag-and-drop reordering
- **Auto-create personas** from target groups with one click
- **Bidirectional name sync** between vision target groups and personas
- **AI content generation** for vision statement, needs, product description
- **Collaborative editing** with real-time updates
- **Export to PDF or JPEG** for presentations
- **Version history** to track changes over time
steps.outcome: **Aligned team** with clear strategic direction and shared understanding of product goals.
steps.next_step: *Next:* Target groups automatically become User Personas for deeper customer research.

steps.title: ### Understand Your Customers Deeply

faq.headline: ## Frequently Asked Questions About Our Product Discovery Tool

questions.question: ### What is a product discovery tool and how does it differ from Google Docs?
questions.answer: A **product discovery tool** like Discover provides structured canvases (Product Vision, User Personas, Business Model Canvas) specifically designed for product teams, with automatic data syncing between artifacts. Google Docs is generic‚Äîyou're building everything from scratch with no integration. With Discover, when you define target groups in your Vision, they automatically become Personas. When you research persona pains/gains, they auto-populate your Business Model. This integrated product discovery platform eliminates duplicate data entry and ensures consistency across all discovery artifacts.

questions.question: ### Do I need all three features (Vision, Personas, Business Model)?
questions.answer: You can use any feature standalone, but the power comes from integration. Most successful teams follow the product discovery process in order: (1) **Product Vision** to align on strategy, (2) **User Personas** for deep customer research using our user persona template, (3) **Business Model Canvas** to validate viability. If you already have a vision, you can start directly with Personas or Business Model. The system still benefits from data syncing‚Äîfor example, updating a Persona name automatically updates it everywhere.

questions.question: ### How does risk scoring work and why does it matter?
questions.answer: On Persona cards (jobs, pains, gains, needs), you score two dimensions: **Importance** (1-5: how much this matters to the customer) and **Uncertainty** (1-5: how confident you are in this assumption). Items with high importance AND high uncertainty are automatically flagged for experimentation‚Äîthese are risky assumptions that could kill your product if wrong. This product validation framework helps you focus validation efforts on what matters most, rather than wasting time testing low-risk items. Many users also ask: 'how to validate product ideas before building' ‚Äî and the answer is that our platform guides you through continuous product discovery methods with built-in risk assessment.

questions.question: ### Can I export artifacts for stakeholder presentations?
questions.answer: Yes! Every canvas (Vision, Personas, Business Model) can be exported to **PDF** or **JPEG** with professional formatting. Great for investor decks, executive reviews, team workshops, and product discovery workshop facilitation. Exported files are high-resolution and ready to embed in slide presentations. You can also share live links to canvases for real-time collaboration.

questions.question: ### How does AI assist with the product discovery process?
questions.answer: AI helps you get started faster by generating content suggestions for vision statements, persona bios, jobs-to-be-done, value propositions, and business model blocks. You provide brief inputs (e.g., target customer description), and AI generates structured content following best product discovery best practices. You then review, edit, and refine the generated content. AI accelerates the process but never replaces human judgment and customer research.
